intro: Anemia pilosa, commonly known as hairy anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It features a short, stout rhizome and produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers during the spring. The plant has fuzzy, hairy leaves that are typically heart-shaped or ovate in form. Its flowers are composed of numerous petal-like sepals, giving it a delicate, fluffy appearance. Anemia pilosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
